result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A Gamez

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Anderson requests time to review discovery with client. 
Atty Anderson requests offer.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Scott A Gamez not in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Scott A Gamez.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Anderson has just been appointed in this matter and requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Aaron Anderson
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on August 1, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

02:17 PM Defendant Scott A Gamez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
